alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 10:21PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Rogers, east central Osage, northwestern Mayes, southern Washington and northeastern Tulsa Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1020 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Avant to 5 miles southwest of New Alluwe. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Skiatook... Collinsville... Chelsea... Oologah... Foyil... Talala... Vera... Bushyhead... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 270 and 271. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
